Choose created permission set and add folowing access:
Object Settings - Account Wallet - Object Permissions: Read / Create / Edit / Delete
Object Settings - Inbound Blockchain Transactions - Object Permissions: Read / Create / Edit / Delete

Step by step instructions are as follows:
Digital Asset Wallets Web3 Enabler One Time Setup: Authorization and Authentication

Thank you for installing Digital Asset Wallets. Digital Asset Wallets uses a connected app and an integration user to bring Blockchain Data into Salesforce. To comply with Salesforce's strict security requirements, administrators must create and authorize this user. All Digital Asset Wallets features will utilize the same Connected App and Integration User.
Failure to do this step will result in failures to connect Blockchain Payment data to Salesforce data.
Enter Setup, Search for Permission Sets and create 2 following permission sets.
Create a new Permission Set named 'Web3 Enabler Integration Access' without license.
Choose 'Assigned Connected App' -> Add 'MuKn Web3 CA'.
Create a new Permission Set named 'Web3 Enabler Object Access' with license 'Salesforce API Integration'.
Choose 'Object Settings' -> Choose 'Accounts' -> Edit -> View All.
Step by step instructions are as follows:

Web3 Enabler includes the permission sets necessary for most operations. There are a few permissions that cannot be added by developers, so we will walk through the installation.</br>The permission in question are authorization to the ConnectedApp, that allows the communication, and access to the Standard Object Account.
Step 1: Create an Additional Permission Sets
Give your new Integration User reasonable names and logins.
Use an email you can monitor.
Salesforce Profile: Salesforce API Only System Integrations.
After saving, Edit Permission Sets for this user and assign:
Requirements of this User are as follows:

We highly recommend the use of a Salesforce Integration user for this program. Web3 Data is highly sensitive data, and the data being reported is financial. We want a clear history in Salesforce of any changes here.
Make sure you have the User/Password from the User Created in Step Two.
Go to the "Web3 Enabler Setup Tab" and click Authorize My Org (we recommend that you right-click and use an Incognito / Private Browser). Login and Authorize.
After Authorization, refresh the Web3 Enabler Setup Tab, you should see everything.
Please select Setup, then Object Manager, then Account Wallet, then Page Layouts, then Page Layouts Assignments.
Please configure Page Layouts Assignments so that Record Type Master and EVM have the value EVM Account Wallet Layout and record type UTXO has the value UTXO Account Wallet Layout.
Please select Setup, then Object Manager, then Org Wallet, then Page Layouts, then Page Layouts Assignments.
Please configure Page Layouts Assignments so that Record Type Master and EVM have the value EVM Org Wallet Layout Layout and record type UTXO has the value UTXO Org Wallet Layout.

labels.shortDescription: Setup Bitrank Api Key Not Set
labels.value: BitRank API Key is not set

Optional. BitRank is a blockchain intelligence software that provides fast, easy, and accurate real-time monitoring and scoring of transactions and wallets to stop transactions with bad actors and sanctioned entities.
A time given in minutes that defines how long the BitRank Score will be valid, and no further checking will be performed during this time.
Please provide values in minutes 0 hour - 0, 1 hour - 60, 24 hours - 1440, 1 week - 10080

labels.shortDescription: Setup CoinGecko Api Key Not Set
labels.value: CoinGecko Pro API Key is not set
CoinGecko Pro API Key is set

Optional. The Coingecko API is used for Cryptocurrency to Fiat exchange rates. The limits of the Free API should be sufficient for all normal operations. If you have or register for Coingecko Account, you can use your API Key here to get more precise and up to date exchagne rates.
From this screen Web3 Enabler for Salesforce is Connected to the Web3 Enabler System
On this screen you can configure the advanced Web3 Enabler for Salesforce.

WARNING: If you have not completed the Post Install Setup, the authorization will succeed, but you will get strange error messages and data will not flow properly. Please complete the Post Install Setup first.

The production environment is the live system where real business data is stored and actual day-to-day operations take place. Changes made here are immediately visible to users and affect the company's live processes. In contrast, a sandbox environment is a copy of the production environment used for development, testing, and training without impacting the live system. Sandboxes allow administrators and developers to test new features, configurations, and customizations in a risk-free setting before deploying them to production.

Accepted payment variance refers to the allowable difference between the invoiced amount and the payment received during transaction processing. When setting up, this tolerance can be configured to a specific percentage, ensuring that minor discrepancies do not result in payment rejections or delays.

labels.shortDescription: Setup Web3Enabler Payment Variance Accepted Help
labels.value: Please enter what percentage of payment variance you accept, if you do not accept any enter 0.
Welcome to Web3 Enabler Blockchain Payments!

Welcome to Web3 Enabler Blockchain Payments. Blockchain Payments allows you to do business in the blockchain using Web3 technologies. </br> To enable receiving payments, start by adding one or more Org Wallets.

The Org Wallets are the wallets belonging to the Salesforce organization. The wallets may be created manually with the wallet address, or automated with Wallet Connect. </br>To protect your safety, only the public key is recorded when verifying the wallet. Your private key is never sent to Salesforce.

Your assets in the wallet are only accessible by the private key holder. They may be used to validate the wallet, but your organization members do not hace access to the wallet. </br>Your accounting department will need to verify the assets with the private key.

Accounts may also have one or more wallets. Payments from an Account Wallet to an Org Wallet are recorded by Web3 Enabler. </br>Customers may also enter their public key manually or use Wallet Connect. Payments must be made with access to the private key.
Do NOT Share your Private Key
Web3 Enabler and affiliated companies will never ask for your private key. You should not share your private key. The wallet manager should be the only person with access, plus a recovery process.
